Title: Nigeria to end foreign issuance of shipping waivers
Summary: Minister of Marine and Blue Economy, Adegboyega Oyetola, has announced plans to end the issuance of waivers under the Coastal and Inland Shipping Act 2003 . Minister made this known on Sunday in a statement by his spokesperson, Dr Bolaji .

Title: Tinubu bags lifetime African achievement award
Summary: President Bola Tinubu bagged the Lifetime African Achievement award from the Millennium Excellence Foundation based in Ghana . The award was given to the patron of the Foundation, Otumfuo Osei Tutu .

Title: Adeleke directs commencement of Osun House project in Abuja
Summary: Ademola Adeleke directs commencement of Osun House project in Abuja . Osun State governor said work will commence on the state’s house project abandoned for 13 years .

Title: Cultism: Edo threatens legal action against Neo Black Movement
Summary: Edo Government has warned and begun consultations for legal action against Neo Black Movement, also known as Black Axe, over the spate of killings and cult-related violence in the state . This is contained in a statement on Monday .

Title: Fan violence casts shadow over Nigerian football league
Summary: Vincent Temitope, a forward with Nigerian football club Plateau United, was bleeding after suffering a horrific cut to his neck . He was attacked after he had scored in the 3-2 loss away to Nasarawa United .

Title: Fubara visited me; crisis was self-inflicted — Wike breaks silence
Summary: "Yes, he came with two governors, and unfortunately, the two of them are APC governors," Wike said . "He said he wants peace, and I said I want peace too," he said .

Title: PDP revamps BoT, eyes unity for 2027 victory
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) is currently holding a crucial meeting at its National Headquarters in Abuja to inaugurate some of the newly appointed state and zonal nominees to its Board of Trustees . This development represents a significant step in the party’s efforts to revitalise its internal structures .

Title: ‘Fornication is not a sin,’ Falz sparks online debate
Summary: Falz made the controversial statement via his official X (formerly Twitter) handle . The entertainer simply posted: “Fornication is not a sin.” The controversial statement was made on Sunday .

Title: Pope urges release of journalists for ‘seeking truth’
Summary: Pope Leo XIV called on Monday for the release of journalists jailed "for seeking and reporting the truth" Pope warned reporters against using their words to fan hatred .

Title: IPOB declares May 30 lockdown to remember Biafra heroes
Summary: IPOB declares May 30 lockdown to remember Biafra heroes and heroines . The group stated that the lockdown is an annual memorial and remembrance day . IPOB says it is a remembrance day for Biafrra heroes .

Title: EFCC to question Tompolo over alleged Naira abuse
Summary: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has said that former Niger Delta militant leader, Chief Government Ekpemupolo, popularly known as Tompolo, will be questioned over alleged naira abuse . In a post on its official X (formerly Twitter) handle on Monday, the anti-graft agency reiterated that no one is

Title: IPOB declares May 30 sit-at-home to honour Biafra heroes
Summary: The Indigenous People of Biafra has declared a sit-at-home on May 30, 2025 . The group said the day would be a yearly memorial to Biafrans who died during the BiaFran War . IPOB spokesperson, Emma Powerful, in a statement on Monday, said day would include lectures in honour

Title: US, China agree to slash tariffs in trade war de-escalation
Summary: The United States and China agree to drastically reduce tit-for-tat tariffs for 90 days . The world’s two biggest economies agreed in a joint statement to bring their triple-digit tariffs down to two figures and continue negotiations . China hailed the “substantial progress” made at the talks, which were held at

Title: Zelensky invites pope to Ukraine during first phone call
Summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday invited Pope Leo XIV to Ukraine during their first phone call . He also thanked the newly installed pontiff for urging peace in Ukraine . The two leaders also discussed “the thousands of Ukrainian children deported by Russia” The two agreed to “plan an in-person meeting in

Title: Ondo airlifts 316 pilgrims to S'Arabia in first batch Hajj trip
Summary: The Ondo State Muslim Welfare Board says the first batch of 316 pilgrims have departed to Saudi Arabia . State Board Chairman, Alhaji Dhikirulahi Chandy-Adam, made the disclosure in a phone interview with the News Agency of Nigeria on Monday . The pilgrims had already been vaccinated for yellow fever and meningitis
